required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Efficacy Study of STSP-0601 in Adult Patients With Hemophilia A or B With Inhibitor
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib/II,Multi-center, Open, Multiple-dose Design to Evaluate the Safety,Tolerability and Efficacy of STSP-0601 for Injection in Patients With Inhibitory Hemophilia

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the safety and efficacy of multiple-dose of STSP-0601 for the treatment of bleeding episodes in hemophilia A or B patients with inhibitors.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From day 0 to up to day 8

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of successfully treated bleeding episodes
primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after first administration of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of successfully treated bleeding episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 hours after first administration of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of successfully treated bleeding episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours after first administration of study drug

arm_group.arm_group_label: Consecutive doses of low-dose of STSP-0601
Consecutive doses of high-dose of STSP-0601

intervention.description: A multiple-dose design to evaluate the safety,tolerability and efficacy of two doses of STSP-0601 for injection in patients with inhibitory hemophilia
intervention.arm_group_label: Consecutive doses of low-dose of STSP-0601

intervention.description: A multiple-dose design to evaluate the safety,tolerability and efficacy of two doses of STSP-0601 for injection in patients with inhibitory hemophilia
intervention.arm_group_label: Consecutive doses of high-dose of STSP-0601

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years old ≤age≤65 years of age,male.
- Hemophilia A or B patients with inhibitors.
- Peak historical inhibitor titer ≥ 5 BU and a positive inhibitor test when enrolled.
- Establish proper venous access.
- Agree to use adequate contraception to avoid pregnancy.
- Provide signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have any coagulation disorder other than hemophilia A or B.
- Treat with prophylactic treatment of coagulation factor.
- Treat with anticoagulant within 7d of the time of study drug administration.
- Have a history of arterial and/or venous thromboembolic events.
- Have platelet count <100,000/mL,hemoglobin<90g/L.
- Severe liver or kidney disease.
- Accept major operation or blood transfusion within 1 month of the time of screening.
- Have a known allergy to Blood product.
- Participate in other clinical research within 1 month of the time of study drug administration.

facility.name: Hospital of Hematology, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences
